sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"普通的，普遍的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: common, ordinary, commonplace, general, usual, popular, universal
means: common ： 多用于指物，侧重很常见，不稀奇。
ordinary ： 用于物，指每天发生，十分平淡无奇；用于人，指无特别之处，很一般。
general ： 语气强于common，侧重大多如此，很少有例外情况。
usual ： 指常见常闻和常做的事或举动，强调惯常性。
popular ： 指适应大众爱好、需要，为大家所公认或接受。
universal与general同义，但语气较强，侧重对每个人或事物都适用，根本没有例外。

sentence.Network_en: He was probably right to intuit that it was universal.
sentence.Network_cn: 他凭直觉认为它具有普遍性，也许他是正确的。

sentence.Network_en: The insurance industry has produced its own proposals for universal health care.
sentence.Network_cn: 保险业提出了自己的全民医疗保健方案。

sentence.Network_en: By 1920, Fox and Universal were already names to conjure with.
sentence.Network_cn: 到1920年，福克斯和环球已经声名显赫。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin universalis, from universus (see universe)

entry.def: Something that is universal relates to everyone in the world or everyone in a particular group or society.

example.ex: The insurance industry has produced its own proposals for universal health care...
example.tran: 保险业提出了自己的全民医疗保健方案。

example.ex: The desire to look attractive is universal.

entry.def: Something that is universal affects or relates to every part of the world or the universe.
A universal is a principle that applies in all cases or a characteristic that is present in all members of a particular class.

example.tran: 没有普遍适用的经济学原理。

means.word_mean: 1. coupling that connects two rotating shafts allowing freedom of movement in all directions;

sentences.sentence: "in motor vehicles a universal joint allows the driveshaft to move up and down as the vehicle passes over bumps"
"the shrewdest political and ecumenical comment of our time"- Christopher Morley

stems_affixes.value_cn: 逆的,相反的;敌对的;不利的;有害的

a坏+vers转+e→往坏转→反感的
con一起+verse=vers转+ant……的→在一起转→很熟悉的
con共同+vers转+e→两个共同对着转→相反的
di分开+vers转+e→转开了→不同的
in进+vers转+e→转进去得→倒转的
ir不+reversible[adj.可逆的]→adj.不可逆转的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 刚愎自用的,故意作对的

re反+vers转+e→反转的
reverse反转的+ible可..的→可反转的,可逆的

vers转+ed……的→转过的,已经熟练了→熟练的

adverse[adj.逆的,相反的;敌对的;不利的;有害的]+ity表名词→n.不幸,灾难
anni=ann+vers转+ary表名词→一年转到一次→周年纪念日
averse[adj.厌恶的,反对的]+ion表名词→n.嫌恶,憎恨
converse[v.谈话,交谈,认识]+ation表名词→n.会话,谈话
con共同+vers转+e→两个共同对着转→相反的
con共同+vers转+ion表名词→n.转变,转换;信仰的改变

stems_affixes.value_cn: 转向,转移;牵制;解闷;娱乐

diverse多样的+ity表名词→n.多样,变化万千
in进+vers转+e→转进去得→倒转的

Sentence.sentence: In contrast to each of these ideas, Covey advocates that leaders need to understand universal principles of effectiveness, and he highlights how vital it is for leaders to first personally manage themselves if they are to enjoy any hope of outstanding success in their work environments.

means.word_mean: 普遍的；全体的；全世界的；共同的

sentences.en: His speech met with universal applause.
sentences.cn: 他的演讲博得全场的喝彩。

sentences.en: These habits are both universal among mankind and peculiar to individuals.
sentences.cn: 这些习惯在全人类中很普遍, 而对个人来说又很独特。

means.word_mean: 在世界各地的, 世界性的

sentences.en: Climate change is a universal problem.
sentences.cn: 气候变化是个世界性的问题。

jushi.english: His speech met with universal applause.
jushi.chinese: 他的演讲博得全场的喝彩。
人口过剩是个世界性的问题。
